Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected for A Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Hotwire.com, where they didn't reveal the name until after you booked. This is an old hotel where only one elevator worked, which sucks when you have luggage and kids. You can't walk from the lobby to the elevator up to your room. You have to walk outside and then get on an elevator. You don't have on sight parking. The neighborhood is terrible and not a good choice for a hotel on a family vacation. I WON'T BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but this hotel is quite tired...”
Reviews.Author: PaulieGA
Reviews.Content: ...and in need of a major refresh. Spent four nights there last week and every staff person I encountered was pleasant and service-oriented, but the layout of the place is odd and the entire atmosphere gives you a sense that you're back in the 1980's; old furnishings in the common areas, dingy colors and sleeping room decor that's bland as can be. It's not a dowtown hotel but it definitely charges downtown-type rates. The place is clean, it's very close to the light rail line and it's connected to a very good health club/gym that serves as the hotel's fitness center. But if I return to Phoenix I would definitely choose a different hotel. Poor value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant and clean”
Reviews.Author: bjw1953
Reviews.Content: Neat and clean, big rooms comfy beds. There is a pool and hottub that looked clear and inviting and a bar - bartender John is a very nice guy - where you can get diner up until 9pm if one doesn't want to venture out in downtown Phoenix at night. The area seems nice, a lot of revitalization going on and the hotel is convenient to the VA Hospital as well as downtown. Only complaint is the outside noise. I had a room on the backside of the hotel and there was a lot of outside mechanical sort of noise most of the night. Never did figure out what it was All in all a little pricy but I would stay again if business calls be to that area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Elisa C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Hilton hotels around the country, so I feel qualified to say that this hotel is an embarrassment to the chain. I was really disappointed in this hotel, though there was no one specific thing the management could have done to change my experience. The entire hotel needs updating: carpet is old, doors are old, carpet pad in my room had long gaps making the floor uneven, the configuration of the hotel is very odd with a long walk from the lobby to a separate building to access guest rooms (going outside and back inside again). And one of the elevators isn't in operation because supposedly it's being updated, though I didn't see any work being done and I was there 2 full weekdays. The parking lot is also a little distance from the hotel so that is another inconvenience. As far as Hiltons go, this was worse than most Hampton Inns I've stayed at. This does not at all meet the standard I've come to expect for Hilton Garden Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Really not your typical garden inn”
Reviews.Author: Louise40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old. Definitely not your typical HGI. No food available Sunday night. Only 2 people in the hotel the guy working check in and the shuttle driver. Hilton just up the road much nicer.a

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times, but its time for an update!”
Reviews.Author: Highwaydude
Reviews.Content: I have probably stayed at this hotel 6 times or more. What I like about this hotel is location, easy parking, comfortable rooms. But it is beginning to show its age and in my opinion needs some refreshing. The carpet walking back to the hotel rooms is in need of replacement. One of my biggest complaints this past trip is not being able to plug in my phone charger next to the bed. There is no outlets, unless you pick one near the desk, which isn't even close the bed. Most hotels now days have outlets in the lamps or at least closer. Overall I still enjoy this hotel. I just feel they need some updating to keep up with the times. One recommendation is have breakfast at "The Good Egg".

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds and quiet place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: photoguy66degrees
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for action, in-hotel restaurant and full service bar, this is not your hotel. If you are looking for a quiet place to sleep and plan to take your lunch and dinner meals outside the hotel, and have your own car, the price is right and the location good for nearby freeways. Staff are friendly. Louis, on check-in, on a Saturday, recommended the Macayos Restaurant, which was good, about one block from the hotel. Parking is about 100 yards away in an adjacent parking lot. The hotel is about 100 yards from the Phoenix Light Rail Stop. I stayed here four nights and used the hotel extensively when on business here in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “No water in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: Typical HGI property, seems to be under renovation so I hope the issues are related to that. Large clean room. Bathroom looks like a bath fitter special with bad sealer, a soap tray that fell out of the plastic wall, a broken shower head that sprayed gallons of water on the floor and water pressure comparable to a faucet dribble. Not up to HGI standards.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the hospital”
Reviews.Author: flowerfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and was pleased with the hotel in general. Staff is efficient & interested in helping with any issues that come up. I chose not to pay for the breakfasts but did take advantage of the free Starbucks coffee in the mornings by the restaurant area. The room was quiet, clean & larger than most in this price range. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was nice, clean, roomy & very functional; it may have been upgraded since the comments of other folks. Plenty of free parking. Free morning newspaper at your door. It's midtown location is very convenient for central Phoenix but not a place for evening entertainment. Easy drive to St. Josephs hospital. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Originally Built as a Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: RunawayBoomer
Reviews.Content: If you are familiar with Hilton Garden Inns in general, you may be disappointed with this hotel. It was not built as a Hilton Garden Inn, but converted from a Lexington Hotel. As a result, the hotel does not have some of the physical features - large, bright, airy lobby and dining area - that are the norm. It felt a little boxed in as a result. That said, the location is good (just off Central, connected to an office building), the service is friendly and competant, they have the standard breakfast offerings (important to me), the room was large and clean, and the free wi-fi worked. The pool area is nice and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “My Monthly Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wtlftdoc
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here once a month for the last year and a half. In a nutshell, it is a nice hotel with a great front desk. The rooms are not fancy, but they are always clean and usually pretty quiet. The attached full-service Health Club is a big plus. I agree it is a "solid" place; not fancy, but a nice place to stay. The pros: 1. Great front desk and maintenance staff 2. Clean rooms 3. The aforementioned Health Club 4. Nice Lobby 5. Plenty of free parking 6. The pool and jacuzzi look nice, although I have never used them The cons: 1. Heating and Cooling system is out of date with the old "dial" controls. I have had instances where the room did not cool as much as I thought it should. 2. The restaurant breakfast service can be more miss than hit. I have tried it twice and will not eat there again due to poor service. 3. You must walk outside to get from one wing of the hotel to the lobby. In Phoenix this is usually not an issue, but I have been rained on once or twice.

Reviews.Title: “Aging...not your typical Hilton Garden Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Debanne1931
Reviews.Content: We've always been happy with Hilton Garden Inns and have appreciated the "familiar" feel of them. This one, however, was entirely disappointing! The rooms felt old and dated, with stained carpeting, crumbling ceiling in the bathroom, old fixtures, uncomfortable dated furniture, and absolutely no freebies (i.e. breakfast or afternoon snacks). Breakfast was way over-priced and poorly staffed. Our room wasn't ready in time, we weren't happy with our room but had no other choices. The manager is rude and snippy, and didn't appear to care at all for the company's slogan regarding satisfaction or it's free (which was prominently displayed at the check-in counter and on elevators...ironic). The only plus with this property was that guests can utilize a fitness club located nearby - it's a long walk but it's an ok fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Hiltton Garden Inn, Midtown, Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: merishore25
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and most of the staff is friendly. They try very hard to make the guest comfortable. The shuttle driver and bartender go out of their way tomake people feel welcome. The shuttle service is very dependable. The wait staff at breakfast are friendly too. However, it's a long walk to the room with luggage through a dark dining area or through the pool. Breakfast ALWAYS closes early so, if they say it's open until 10:00 and you get there are 9:45 almost everything is put away, which makes you feel uncomfortable and the restaurant closes on the weekends, Friday, Saturday and Sunday except for breakfast and room service shuts down on the weekends. There is also no security at this hotel what so ever. The gym next door that you have access to is pretty nice, but the staff isn't and they have signs which say Hotel key and photo ID required, No Exceptions which makes you feel uncomfortable before you even walk in to workout. I have stayed at much nicer Hilton Garden Inns and think the management needs to make sure that the Hilton offers more than this hotel. However, in comparison to the surrounding hotels being the Raddison. Fairfield Inn and Holiday Inn the HGI is much nicer. The only other option would be to stay at the full service Hilton or the Marriott, which are a bit further away. So it depends on the reason you are there and what amenities you want. It is close to the Light Rail..

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: FyrDncr715
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying there, and this place was a pretty good option. Just a block off the 'main drag.' Parking is across the street, and the front desk will give you passes if you ask. There's a little cafe across the street and the food is awesome. The hotel has breakfast - for $12 you could have access to: fruit, granola, yogurt, scrambled eggs, potatoes, biscuits, sausage and bacon, cereal, bagels/bread, danishes, Starbucks coffee, an omelet station and waffle station. Great if you want a hearty breakfast, but if you're a light breakfast eater, you may want to find some place else and not waste your time or get a muffin from their pantry (located right by the front desk). The pantry was a pretty good idea - beverages, snacks, toiletries in one convenient spot. Of course, you're probably better hitting up the Walgreens (open 24 hours) a few blocks down if you want to get things cheaper. The hotel is also only a block from Fez - check it out to get a burger or drink! There are also other restaurants within walking distance. The rooms in the West Tower are a bit more updated than the Cabana rooms. My room (west tower) was alright - carpet was fine, comfortable king size bed (you can adjust the firmness), chair and ottoman, desk with ergonomic chair, pool view, metal luggage stand (in closet, ironing board, mini fridge, microwave, and TV. The bathroom could have used some updating - mainly the shower. Also - water pressure was really not all that great. It's a shame - they have the showerheads with the adjustable streams (mist, massage, etc.) but because the water pressure was so low, it didn't really matter what setting you had it on. My room also had an adjoining door to another room - I imagine you would be able to request something like this should you need it - which could be a plus for families if needed (although, this is not really a 'family' hotel - more like for business trips/adults. Internet in the room was free - both wifi and hardwired. The air conditioning was hard to adjust - it was freezing in my room no matter what I did to the thermostat, so I just turned it off. The hotel was relatively quiet - my room was right by the ice machine. You didn't really hear it much, but it would be annoying had the hotel been more full. The pool area was nice - hot tub is right by it. I'm not sure if all rooms were nonsmoking, but I went out front and around the corner to the right where the designated smoking area was. Front desk staff was friendly. They have a business center with 2 computers and a printer/fax machine/scanner. I had issues with printing from the computer on the left, but the computer on the right went smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & perfect location but conference services and parking situation is pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: AZVagabonder
Reviews.Content: We've had an extended conference session at this hotel and I am disappointed in the services, some of the attitude, and the poor parking situation. Wifi isn't designed for high usage either. We've been having issues everyday. For the most part, staff is friendly, although there have been a few that seem jaded and cold when asked for help. The limited free parking is behind the hotel, and a $10 per day lot is up front. Hotel refuses to validate when free lot is full, even after booking two conference rooms for 5 or 6 weeks. They also don't like to share coffee, or refill waters very timely. I am sure the rooms are great though, and as I mentioned the central location is ideal. But, if you want to earn repeat business from a local business owner, try hooking us up with some free coffee, on the spot water service, and some free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Weird...”
Reviews.Author: Roddy_Rod
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is hard to find and trying to locate their parking lot is not any easier, especially when you pull up to the hotel and one of the employees just stares at you and your car and doesn't even ask of you need help. The front desk person who checked me in was very unfriendly and had 0 personality and was frankly unwelcoming however works in hospitality which is ironic. I stayed in one of the Non-Cabana rooms which I had to walk through the hotel and outside to get to. The lobby and meeting room areas where fill of junk and messy. The hotel is basic in everyway possible and the bathrooms remind me of a motel 6. Granted you should know that I'm a diamond hhonors member and they should at least true try to give me a decent room that doesn't overlook the street parking and power plant.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, picking up son at ASU downtown.”
Reviews.Author: cinderella4jc
Reviews.Content: Parking free across street from hotel, good. Lobby nice and open and clean, front desk guy ok. Stayed in tower floor 5 quiet clean and nice, a business class room with desk, free internet, fridge, microwave, bathroom clean and nice. Beds were awesome, so comfortable. Location was ok midtown Phoenix 10 mins to Downtown ASU campus and 5 mins to hwy 10 and 51. No starbucks nearby. Would stay here again..booked on Expedia for 67.00, good price. Non smoking floor was good. Pool nice with waterfall.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest HGI”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hamptons and HGI's because they are pretty standard. This HGI was a little dated. My room was right off the elevator and faced the pool - it was extremely loud there due to proximity, I believe, to the service closet on the floor. I had breakfast one morning - service was HORRIBLE. I actually left no tip, it was so bad. The omelette station guy was the only nice one in there. I was halfway through my meal before I even got water from the manager, and he wasn't pleasant at all. I had to flag down the waiter, who had never even come over to the table, to get my check. And there were only about 5 other people in the restaurant at that time. Gym wasn't bad....you have access to the gym in the office building the hotel is attached to. It's a huge gym with lots of equipment, but its very outdated. No tvs on cardio machines - they actually still have the tvs on the walls and you have to tune your radio to them. Weight machines are also dated. And very little pilates type equipment that's of use. Parking is confusing and somewhat of a short walk. Overall, my stay was fine - I just felt that the hotel was a little sub-standard of the usual HGI.

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard Hilton Garden”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGirlOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dated and common areas a bit beaten up but both are very clean. Parking is off sight but a very short walk, shorter than one would walk at a large hotel or shopping mall. Service is friendly. The pool area is nice. As a guest you get access to City Gym in lieu of a workout room. This is connected to the hotel through an interior hallway. Gym has saunas, steam rooms, showers, whirlpool, classes, basketball courts, the whole bit. Bring your swim suit is you want to use all gym facilities. I was upgraded to a 2 room suite with my Hilton Honors status. My room was a great value at only $89.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie25th
Reviews.Content: reasonable hotel but only stayed for one night whilst in transit. Pool area quite nice - I wouls suggest you request a room overlooking the pool on secondor third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: brich432
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn four times during 2010. The service has been excellent every time. In a couple cases, there have been typical hotel issues with a noisy room or other minor issue. The hotel staff have always been terrific to deal with. They are friendly and helpful, and they have gone out of their way to help me have a good stay each time. The rooms are fine, and the location is convenient enough. There are a few restaurants within walking distance; the Fez restaurant across Central is my favorite nearby. The hotel shuttle will take you to locations within a few miles. They'll even pick you up, and I have found them to be reliable and on time in every case. It's only a couple blocks to walk to the metro light rail, which will take you to the downtown core for a couple bucks. When you need a ride back to the airport, the car service they call is better than a cab for about the same price; it's worth a try. The pool area is nice and the pool is heated, which is a plus during the winter. The health club is a large facility you have access to as a hotel guest - much nicer than a few machines crammed into a tiny room like you find in many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: jkps1
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that appears to have been converted into a Hilton Hotel. The carpets smell of mold. Access to the west tower, where I stayed was uncovered and creepy at night because you have to walk outside. The room was very small and smelled old. The bed was completly uncomfortable. When I moved the mattresss to do my bug check, I found old chips and horrible amounts of dust and debris behind the bed. When I complained to the manger, she flatly told me that I would be be refunded the price of the room, but if I wanted to leave tomorrow, she wouldnt charge me for that night. Needless to say, I did not stay. I would have left the first night, but I was late for a meeting and had already paid for the room. The neighborhood is urban. Lots of runs down and vacant buildings. Not safe feeling for me.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: Edd60
Reviews.Content: Had a nice room bit on the small side and it seemed a little dim due to there only being one smallish window although we had good view of pool area, we had all mod cons tv,coffee maker iron, hairdryer evetything was clean and tidy only a couple of small niggles shower head was loose kept falling off and plug in sink would not seal . nice resturant, food was good(they do some wonderfull burgers) and at a reasonable price, all staff nice and pleasant nice pool area and all was nice and clean no real prolems

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want for this class of hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmrice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here while attending a wedding in Phoenix and we were pleasantly surprised. This hotel was everything it should be - affordable, clean and quiet with a very friendly staff. There is a nice pool and hot tub (request a room with a sliding door out to the patio around the pool and you can walk outside your room and sit in the sun. The pool seemed to be in the shade most of the time.) Free parking was provided. Granted this is Phoenix and you pretty much need a car, but the light rail is nearby and there were several restaurants/cafes close by. Fez, a lively Moroccan restaurant is just across the street and Lux a uber cool coffee shop a short drive away. We also drove to Gallo Blanco - a great modern Mexican bistro in the nearby Clarendon Hotel and Via de los Santos (9121 N. Central) for two great lunches. The airport is 10 minutes away and so is access to great hiking. The Heard Museum is close by as well. The breakfast buffet was $10.95 but had good service and a full cooked to order station. I'd stay here again without questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but kind of in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly typical of HGI. Some of the other reviews indicate that the west tower wasn't renovated but it has been at this point. The room was comfortable. I had a corner room (316) which is a bit bigger but that's about it. The hotel restaurant is only open in the morning for breakfast. There is a room service in the evening but I didn't try it. There are Mexican, Mideastern, and Chinese resturants across the street but that's about it. A Walgreen's is located about 1/3 mile south. Other than that, you are surrounded by office buildings many of which seem to be in need of tenants. This hotel is OK if you have business in the area and a car. The light rail runs down the street in front of the hotel, so you can at least get downtown from here.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gezra
Reviews.Content: No problems with this hotel, modern and clean with good service. Good for a stopover

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not Great- CPAP Users Beware”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member, I am a big fan of the HGI chain. This one is comparable to most, but definitely is not a standard HGI. It is in an older partially renovated hotel, so not the typical HGI layout. Most of the prior comments are on-the mark. Yes, some units you have to walk outside to another building (tower), yes, it is hard to find the dining room, and yes, the parking lot is a hassle - located on the other side of an office building from the hotel. On the plus side, the parking was free, the room (and bathroom) was very spacious and well equipped. The heating/cooling system worked well and was quiet. On the negative side, the room was not real clean - shower tiles had some mildew in the caulking and the carpet appeared dirty. Second, there was a shortage of electrical (AC) outlets - 4 for the entire room and all were in use - including a large extension cord that allowed two lamps and a clock radio to plug into one outlet (fire safety?). Although there were 3 plugs on the side of the desk for electronics, CPAP users will be dismayed to find there were no outlets by the bed available unless you unpluged a lamp or clock from the extension cord. When will hotels realize that lots of people with sleep apnea use these medical devices by their beds at night. Why can't they get lamps with AC outlets in them - like many hotels (and other HGI's) do. This was a big issue for me. If I was in this area of town, I would probably return because overall it is a decent hotel and meets my basic needs, but it is nothing close to being as nice as the Hilton in Chandler, or many other HGI properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PMaloney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. Reception: Friendly and efficient Room: The hotel consists of 2/3 buildings so you may have to cross the pool area to get to your room. This was the case for me and it takes approx 5 minutes. Not a problem for me and I it has taken me longer to get to my room in other hotels The room was clean and functional. I have stayed in a number of other hilton hotels and this, while not bad was the lowest calibre. There is free wireless access in all rooms also. Pool: Pool was heated and the area was quite nice. Breakfast: Catered for most tastes Location: It is a 30 second walk away from central avenue and a few minutes walk to the tram. Overall a decent hotel. I would recommend having a look at other hotels nearby though.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, and the staff is friendly. However, there are serpentine hallways, and it is an older building. The parking is a bit away from the main entrance. If you need to be in Central Phoenix, the location is excellent - and it served our purposes quite well: instead of renting a car at the airport, we took a cab to the hotel ($25), and picked up our car the next morning at the Hertz right around the corner from the hotel, and saved all those airport fees (which, in Phoenix are HUGE) ... Definitely wouldn't recommend this place for a Phoenix VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Triad333
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing for a Hilton property. Terrible configuration with many, if not most rooms, only accessible by going outside, around the pool, into another building and up the elevator. I was here on the weekend and there was no room service, no dining, and no bar. Even the gift shop was closed. There are no vending machines to even get a soda. I'm not that picky but SOME kind of food or beverage service is not unreasonable is it?

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience HGI Phoenix/Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: Needing a break from things back at home, it was time to head to the sun for some fun. I have stayed at various HiltonHHonors properties in the Phoenix area, and decided to stay close to the downtown area this time. After search for good rates, I decided to try this property and wasn't a bit disappointed! Once I got to the property, checked-in, and decided what I wanted to do, I realized the new Metro Light Rail line was less than 2 blocks away! (The Indian School Road/Central Avenue stop is the one you want for this hotel). The light rail takes you east to Mesa, and north to Montibello Ave/19th Street. This was the way to get around when you don't have a car! The staff were very helpful and very gracious, very accommodating, and some of the best I've experience!! The property isn't your "typical" Hilton Garden Inn, this was apparently a hotel of a different name at one time. The common areas and rooms are dated and showing wear and tear, and need a re-do. The entire property could stand a major face lift. That's my only negative comment, everything else was outstanding. As HiltonHHonors Gold, I got an upgrade to a king suite - very spacious and perfect for an extended weekend trip. I loved all of the room! Breakfast coupons were also available. The breakfast offering is buffet with made-to-order omlets and waffles. I figured it was just another HGI standard breakfast buffet. I was amazed at how good the scrambled eggs were, along with the breakfast potatoes! This was one of the best breakfast buffets I've experienced in awhile. I could eat this every day but would gain more weight than I would like!! Great food, good service. The hotel does not offer lunch or dinner - the property is among corporate midtown Phoenix, so weekends are very quiet. Perfect time to come for a get away! The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle within a five mile radius -- a trip to Biltmore Fashion Park was a nice change of pace. All in all, this was a great experience, the property is in the midtown area of Phoenix. If you don't have a car, there are various restaurants you can walk to, or just hop the light rail ($10.50 for a 3-day unlimited pass) and head downtown. The Heard Museum and Phoenix Art Museum are 2-stops from the hotel. If you want to do in-room food, a Super Target is a light rail ride to the north at the Montibello/19th Avenue stop. I highly recommend this property for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: fun2dive
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. The breakfast was one of the best I have experienced. The hotel was new and clean. The pool was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay there”
Reviews.Author: texch
Reviews.Content: Great location and value. July is not there peak season, ha ha! They gave me an upgraded room and free breakfest. Room was great and very clean. All employees where very friendly and made u feel at home. I travel alot and this was one of my favorite hotel experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for price”
Reviews.Author: auntieA05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. It is quite new. The mattresses are very comfortable and adjustable for firmness. The room we stayed in had a new flat screen television, mini-fridge, microwave and free wi-fi. We stayed here the last night of our vacation to the Grand Canyon. It was the least expensive, cleanest, and modern hotel we stayed in the whole trip. The hotel isn't located in the nicest neighborhood, but we never felt unsafe. As an added bonus, the decor is really modern and pretty!

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre Place”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: Well if you can actually find the place it is interesting to say the least. I was in a room on the 7th floor of the "West" tower. From the looks of it I was one of two on the entire 7th floor the night I stayed. It is a long and hot walk to the West tower...either you cut through a dark and closed restaurant or go outside around the pool. I could not find the tower without help from housekeeping. The rooms are old, tired, and poorly outfitted. Don't look closely at anything...particularly the drapes and windows. If you can get it for $50 a night go for it. Don't wander around the area and call in for food delivery. Breakfast in the "cafe" in the morning is buffet only. The "omlet cook" is anything but and is as surly as they come. He turns the food using his bare hand and tests the warmth of things with his fingers. I left after having a glass of orange juice. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, relaxing stay- no worries”
Reviews.Author: gonerunning
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very cordial, polite, and helpful whenever we needed anything. Our pack n play was delivered promptly to our room. This was the only hotel out of our entire trip that had a room big enough to have the stroller and still have 2 options for where to comfortably put the pack n play. Having refrigerators in each room was a plus. The pool was a bit dirty with tree/landscaping debris, but really the rooms were spacious, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The pool itself was huge, especially if you like to do laps. Plenty of towels at the pool and in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TheScoopBakersfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Midtown in Phoenix AZ. The hotel was located close to downtown, about 4 miles from the Convention Center. They had free safe parking and it's only 9 miles from Scottsdale. If you don't want to drive you can take the train, which is located a block from the hotel. FREE Internet service in the room. Overall my stay was relaxing. http://www.thescoopbakersfield.com

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneWriter
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Hilton Garden Inn and we stayed two nights and enjoyed the experience. All the staff were friendly and professional and the front desk people had good knowledge about places to eat nearby. We booked a king room which was quiet, and the décor was nice, everything was clean and the Internet access was good. The made-to-order omelets at breakfast were great. The guest laundry was clean and well maintained. We’d been told these hotels are aimed at business travelers and we found this to be true. There were function rooms with company meetings taking place, but the guest rooms were at the back and we weren’t disturbed at all. We found it tricky to get to the hotel. The Phoenix light rail construction is not yet finished and some intersections are still closed. The building is part of a corporate square on Central Avenue and we drove by it, thinking we had the wrong street number because you can’t see the hotel from the main road. Guest parking was free, but in the central square carpark next door. This is OK as long as you unload and load your bags at the hotel entrance instead of parking first. We ate across the road at Fez – great food and atmosphere and reasonable prices. Some people said it was a bit noisy, but this is a popular Phoenix after-work meeting spot and we found the music and general liveliness OK. It was worth it for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Only Stayed One Night”
Reviews.Author: pasber
Reviews.Content: My husband (Hilton Gold) and I stayed for one night in early September. This hotel was selected for the price ($55) and its proximity to the airport (NOTE: it is not that close--it is almost 7 miles and a 20 minute trip, and their shuttle will not take you to the airport). The hotel public areas are fine, though a little odd and chopped up. Our concern was with the room and the bed. We received an upgraded room, which was quite large, but we had to lug our cumbersome luggage through two sets of non-automatic double doors, past the swimming pool, in 100 degree heat, to a separate building. The room was on the second floor and had absolutely no view except for the roof, which raised some security issues, as someone could have entered our room through the window. A bigger problem was the bed--it was so soft, with no support, that any movement made by one person could be felt by the other. I complained to the desk clerk about it the next morning (having gotten no sleep) and all she could say was that the beds were new. A car is an absolutely necessity here. There is a parking lot across the street, and the hotel will give out parking passes to present to the attendant. Otherwise, there is not much to do here. We had breakfast in the buffet, which was of good quality, with the usual fare of fruit, hot foods, and cereals. Cost is $10.95, but it is free to Hilton Golds and Diamonds. They will do omelets.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you rent a car. Shuttle service not dependable”
Reviews.Author: Esther51
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention in Phoenix and since I could not get hotel reservations downtown near the convention center, I contacted this hotel because it was recommended on the convention website. The description included the information that the hotel had a shuttle to the convention center. I contacted the hotel and before I made my reservation, I asked if their shuttlel ran regulaly to and from the convention center. They said yes so I booked a room. When I arrived, I inquired as to the shuttle schedule and they told me I had to make a reservation to get a ride. I needed to get to the site by 7:30 but the shuttle that held 6 people was completely booked by other 'conventioneers' and I couldn't get a reservation to leave the hotel unti 8:30! The shuttle service is not adequate nor is it flexible. One afternoon, the shuttle was not scheduled to operate because the driver had to unload a tourist bus. There's also not much shopping around the hotel so you need a car if you're going to stay here. The room was clean and had a microwave and small refrigerator and people who work here are generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmokie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in a good central location. A good value on holiday weekends. Have stayed twice and been very happy both times.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice”
Reviews.Author: shropshire
Reviews.Content: I was attracted by the price which was $62. The fella on reception was so pleasant, As it was late when we arrived from the airport we purchased some convenience food from the parlour pantry in the lobby and heated it up in our microwave in the room. The beds were very comfortable and the room was lovely and quiet. Neutrogena products in the bathroom. You would definately need a car to stay here as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “an ok Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: colinjones217
Reviews.Content: shuttle bus from airort good, room ok and clean, bar and pantry ok, whole lace needs a bit of TLC but after a long flight it was fine especially the comfy bed

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ORDtraverler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for four days. Nice hotel, well maintained. Pool area very nice. Breakfast buffet each morning very good. Place is out of the way and a bit hard to find, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good and questionable”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadsales
Reviews.Content: Upon check in I was given a "Double" room. I reserved a King room but was told only a double was available ( Same price). That was ok since I assumed a "double' meant two beds ( as indicated on their website) Well, My room was located behind the elevators with a double bed. That is one double size bed just larger than a twin. the bed was against the wall of the SMALLEST room I have ever stayed in other than a hostel in my college days. I admit the room was clean and nice. But, SMALL. After checking in I looked at the hotels website and they still listed King, and King Deluxe room available for the same night. I travel every week and try new hotels in the areas I travel, To find a nice hotel with a good work environment. As you can imagine I was not happy with the SMALL room but accepted it. I needed to get work done and on to my Clients. When I checked out I talked to the Manager Christine. She told me it was up to the the front desk clerk to assign me a room at THEIR discrestion. Since I was traveling alone they needed to give me a double to have a king available for other guests. The Manager said this is their policy and did not feel they need to reduce my rates for my (small) room. The Pro's: Great workout facility and snack pantry. MAKE SURE YOU KNOW WHAT ROOM YOU ARE GIVEN PRIOR TO LEAVING THE FRONT DESK. This hotel is in a great location for driving to most areas of Phoenix. There is not very much in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Accomodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msbianca2
Reviews.Content: I purposely booked my stay here again. I was satisfied during my visit. Staff was still good & hotel was accomodating. I will definitely stay here again. Pros: FREE INTERNET & PRINTING!! - LOVED IT!! Personable Staff Cookies & happy hour 24hr. pantry location Cons: Parking (across the street) it's not fun in the heat. No safety deposit box - had to tote my electronics everywhere. Maid service - kind of slow during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Big Room”
Reviews.Author: libertyproject
Reviews.Content: The property is wonderful for an extended stay. The room was large, comfortable and clean and the area is safe. I enjoyed my 5th floor room and view of the pool, and the staff was very friendly during my 10 night stay. I recommend this property for any business traveler who needs to save a few pennies and has a car. This property is not a resort; it is however a clean, comfortable and safe property that offers a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Single women travelers should avoid”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business recently. My biggest complaint as a single woman traveler is that there is no valet parking you have to park in a lot shared with the nearby offices--quite a ways away and kind of a scary walk at night. The rest is unimpressive as well. The hotel is of '60s vintage and though it has been redone, it feels tired and old. The linens are not great (they still have those terrible polyester floral bed spreads and synthetic blankets; sheets were see-through thin). Service also lackluster. Checking in, the front desk attendant was writing a note and left me standing there for several minutes while he finished. The maid service hadn't come around the next day by the time I got back from meetings at 3:00 p.m. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Rooms, Great Downtown Location, Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JazzCruise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel about one month ago. A very friendly check in by a congenial front desk person. Free cookies at check in. The room was very nicely furnished, very clean, very attractive. A/C a bit loud however. My only complaint about this place was that teenagers with their parent's keys were allowed to access the business center and caused a lot of disruption. This is the responsibility of the parents of course, however since the business center is directly across from the front desk the clerks might want to keep their eye on this situation. There are only a few restaurants adjacent to the area ( one block walk ) so either plan on driving elsewhere for dinner or eating at one of the few restaurants in the immediate area. Dining room in the hotel was open only for breakfast while I was there. All in all a clean, comfortable hotel, well located, with a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the high season”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here primarilty for the $ 116 rate and to collect Honors points. The location is great for Phoenix and if you are familiar with the area, February is the highest of the high season so even the budget motels of the world are over $ 100 here. All I was looking for was a clean , quiet room in this area and the HGI turned out to be the right choice. This is a converted mid-rise hotel which for me offers what I like. Old fashioned quality construction, central HVAC and standard rooms that are somewhat larger than the newer designed ones. I had a cabana room, versus the tower, and I assume this was an "upgrade" for Diamond level Honors. At least I didnt have to take the elevator. The lobby was clean, modern and spacious. The room was very clean, had a microwave and fridge, and everything worked. Reading light was great and the web connect was wired in, which I need. Free too, as was the parking. Speaking of parking, this was a drawback for me. The lot is across a side street, so its quite a journey from it to the room. For someone in and out of the car all day, its a pain. Also for Sr Citizens who are possibly less mobile. And in summer it would be a dealbreaker for me in business attire. Of course in the summer you can stay anywhere in PHX just about for $ 116 ! The Breakfast buffet was way above average and free for Honors members. All in all, a real value for the time of the year. Note: Its not in or near Scottsdale so this is not the place if your activities are centered there. Not a bad drive but still about 4-5 miles away by car.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 4000 North Central Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85012
